name: Source Reliability Assessment
description: Training to evaluate the credibility, trustworthiness, and biases of information sources in intelligence and disinformation analysis.

cards.title: Understanding Source Classification
cards.description: Differentiating between primary, secondary, and tertiary sources to determine reliability.
bulletpoints: Identifying firsthand accounts vs. secondhand retellings.
Assessing the credibility of institutional vs. independent sources.
Understanding how proximity to an event affects information accuracy.
cards.summaryText: Classify sources by distance to events, compare institutional weight, and rate freshness of access.

cards.title: Identifying Conflicts of Interest
cards.description: Determining whether a source has a vested interest in shaping a particular narrative.
bulletpoints: Analyzing financial and political motivations behind sources.
Tracking sponsorships, funding sources, and institutional affiliations.
Recognizing astroturfing and manufactured grassroots movements.
cards.summaryText: Follow money and alliances, surface hidden sponsors, and expose faux grassroots fronts.

cards.title: Cross-Referencing & Corroboration
cards.description: Validating claims by comparing multiple independent sources.
bulletpoints: Understanding how triangulation strengthens source reliability.
Detecting discrepancies between sources and identifying red flags.
Using OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) tools for real-time corroboration.
cards.summaryText: Triangulate claims across independents, log contradictions, and lean on OSINT dashboards for quick checks.

cards.title: Evaluating Historical Accuracy
cards.description: Assessing a sourceâ€™s track record for accuracy and credibility over time.
bulletpoints: Tracking past misinformation and retractions from media outlets.
Identifying patterns of bias and recurring misleading narratives.
Assessing the impact of previous reporting on public perception.
cards.summaryText: Pull archival scorecards, flag habitual bias, and weigh historical impact before trusting again.

cards.title: Detecting Emotional & Psychological Manipulation
cards.description: Recognizing when a source is using emotional appeals to override critical thinking.
bulletpoints: Identifying fear-mongering and emotionally charged language.
Recognizing guilt-tripping, outrage cycles, and virtue signaling.
Analyzing language framing and its effect on cognitive biases.
cards.summaryText: Isolate emotional trigger words, chart manipulation cycles, and decode framing that hijacks bias.

cards.title: Analyzing Disinformation Patterns
cards.description: Detecting when a source is spreading deliberate falsehoods.
bulletpoints: Recognizing hallmarks of government-backed or corporate disinformation.
Tracking the evolution of a false narrative through media cycles.
Differentiating between accidental misinformation and active PsyOps.
cards.summaryText: Compare messaging fingerprints, timeline falsehood propagation, and separate sloppy reporting from operations.

cards.title: Verifying Multimedia Authenticity
cards.description: Using forensic analysis to confirm the authenticity of images, videos, and audio.
bulletpoints: Applying metadata analysis to detect tampering and digital manipulation.
Utilizing AI-based deepfake detection techniques.
Cross-referencing visual elements against known databases for verification.
cards.summaryText: Inspect metadata trails, run deepfake scans, and verify visuals against trusted registries.

cards.title: Assessing Alternative Media & Citizen Journalism
cards.description: Evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of non-mainstream media sources.
bulletpoints: Identifying genuine grassroots investigative journalism.
Recognizing potential echo chambers and information silos.
Cross-referencing alternative sources with established intelligence frameworks.
cards.summaryText: Vet citizen reporters, flag silo feedback loops, and benchmark findings with vetted frameworks.

cards.title: Detecting Controlled Opposition
cards.description: Recognizing when a source is posing as independent while serving hidden interests.
bulletpoints: Tracking intelligence and corporate ties behind so-called 'whistleblowers.'
Identifying patterns of misdirection and limited hangout strategies.
Analyzing how opposition narratives are used to neutralize genuine dissent.
cards.summaryText: Probe for covert handlers, document partial-truth misdirection, and assess how faux dissent dampens resistance.

cards.title: Building a Reliable Intelligence Network
cards.description: Creating a system of trustworthy information sources for long-term intelligence work.
bulletpoints: Developing a methodology for vetting and ranking sources.
Building decentralized research teams for multi-perspective verification.
Applying peer review and critical analysis techniques to strengthen assessments.
cards.summaryText: Draft scoring rubrics, coordinate cross-check teams, and enforce peer review loops for durable intel.
